dublin_core.dcvalue: Use of a cellular phone has been shown to negatively affect one s attention to the driving task leading to an increase in crash risk At any given daylight hour about 6 of US drivers are actively talking on a hand held cell phone However previous surveys have focused only on cell phone use during the day Driving at night has been shown to be a riskier activity than driving during the day The purpose of the current study was to assess the rate of hand held cellular phone use while driving at night using specialized night vision equipment
Cellular phone use while driving at night.
